title:
Bearings, Main Shaft and/or Drive Shaft in
Transmission Housing, Replace

steps.text: Illustration of main shaft and drive shaft in transmission housing
Remove transmission from vehicle- see operation "Transmission, Remove and Install"
Disassemble transmission - see operation "Transmission, Seal Completely"
If required, remove and install new, or old, main shaft bearings using KM-6122 (1) in conjunction with KM-523-1 (2)
Remove drive shaft bearing from transmission housing using KM-6123 (3) in conjunction with KM-523-1 (4)
Clean all parts
Check all parts; replace if necessary

When replacing main shaft bearing in transmission housing, pressure collar adjustment must be determined and adjusted if necessary. For this, seat of bearing inner race for main shaft relative to sealing surface of transmission housing must be determined. This is described in following steps
Support transmission housing using wooden block so that main shaft bearing inner ring is unobstructed
Position KM-621-23 (1) on transmission housing (3)

Determine dimension (I) (bearing inner ring to transmission housing sealing surface) using commercially available digital depth gauge (2) with measuring range of at least 250 mm and graduation of 0.01 mm

substeps.text: Perform this measurement at three evenly-spaced measurement
Add measured values and divide sum by number of measurements.

steps.text: Purpose of following tables is to explain pressure comb adjustment using example calculation

After installation, this measurement must be performed in same way for new main shaft bearing. If a value deviates by more than 0.08 mm from other values of a particular measurement, measurement must be repeated as measurement error has occurred

Mean value for new main shaft bearing is then subtracted from mean value for old main shaft bearing. If dimension difference between old and new main shafts is greater than + 0.02-0.06 mm , pressure comb must be adjusted. For this purpose, tapered roller bearings must be removed from differential - see operation "Tapered Roller Bearings - Differential, Remove and Install"
Select shim
